title: Gaza protests: The 60 days a Paris university was at the heart of the national political debate
summary: Sit-ins, blockades, tension and discussions. The Paris university has been the focal point of a student movement calling for an end to the war in Gaza.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Behind the scenes of negotiations for a ceasefire in Gaza
summary: The text submitted by Israel on April 27 had raised hopes of an agreement, which the American, Egyptian, and Qatari mediators have so far failed to achieve.

title: Champions League: Hummels stuns Mbappé and PSG to take Borussia Dortmund to final
summary: Hummels struck five minutes into the second half at the Parc des Princes and PSG were unable to muster a response. Dortmund won 1-0, on Tuesday.

title: At his inauguration, Vladimir Putin commits to a long-term confrontation with the West
summary: 'We look to the future with confidence,' said the Russian president as he began his fifth term in office at a ceremony in the Kremlin attended by the French ambassador.

title: Stormy Daniels describes first meeting Trump in hush money trial
summary: The testimony of the adult movie actress is by far the most-awaited in the hush money trial of former US President Donald Trump.

title: Taylor Swift bill signed into Minnesota law, protecting online ticket buyers
summary: The law, prompted by the frustration of a legislator not able to buy tickets to Swift's concert in Minneapolis, will require ticket sellers to disclose all fees upfront and prohibit resellers from selling more than one copy of a ticket.

title: TikTok sues US to block law that could ban the platform
summary: In its lawsuit, ByteDance says the new law vaguely paints its ownership of TikTok as a national security threat in order to circumvent the First Amendment. It also says the law is 'obviously unconstitutional.'

title: Florida judge indefinitely postpones Trump classified documents trial
summary: The former president had been scheduled to go on trial on May 20 but District Judge Aileen Cannon said that was not possible because of the number of pre-trial motions before the court.

title: Olympic Games 2024: Ukrainian athlete Mariia Vysochanska to carry the Olympic flame in Marseille
summary: While her father fights the Russian invasion, the 21-year-old Ukrainian gymnast has been selected to be one of the athletes who will welcome the Olympic torch when it arrives in Marseille on May 8: a highly symbolic choice, and a source of pride.

title: Scottish parliament names John Swinney as new leader
summary: Swinney succeeds Humza Yousaf, who announced his resignation last week after just over a year in charge.

title: France denounces Iran's 'policy of state hostage-taking'
summary: In a rare statement from a Western government, France condemned Iran's taking of hostages to serve as blackmail to extract concessions from the west, including 4 French citizens, for whom the country demanded the 'immediate and unconditional release.'

title: EU adopts its first law tackling violence against women
summary: The far-reaching law, which criminalizes everything from female genital mutilation to the non-consensual sharing of intimate images, does not include a common EU-wide definition of rape, a measure which France had opposed.

title: For Denver University students, Gaza protests are all about land struggle
summary: On the Auraria campus, home to the red-brick house where former Israeli prime minister Golda Meir lived, most of the students, from modest immigrant backgrounds, identify with the Palestinian cause.

title: Pro-Palestinian voices are silenced in Egypt
summary: The Cairo authorities have arrested and intimidated citizens to prevent their solidarity with Gazans from evolving into a protest movement that could potentially challenge the current regime.

title: Georgia, a dilemma and a challenge for the European Union
summary: Having granted official EU candidate status to the former South Caucasus Soviet republic in December 2023, the Georgian government's openly pro-Russian U-turn is a headache for Brussels.

title: Two women charged in France over graffiti on  'The Origin of the World' famous painting
summary: Two women were charged in France on Tuesday over the spraying of the words 'MeToo' on five artworks including a famous 19th-century painting of a woman's vulva, a prosecutor said.

title: NBA: Minnesota center Rudy Gobert named Defensive Player of the Year for the fourth time
summary: Gobert has the trophies for 2018, 2019, 2021 and 2024. Victor Wembanyama finishes 2nd. The San Antonio rookie center was announced Monday as the league's Rookie of the Year.

title: EU elections: European scientists are worried about mounting populism
summary: A group of scientists of the European Federation of Academies of Sciences and Humanities have signed a letter calling for science and education freedom in Europe as the far right, they say, threatens the 'future of Europe.'

title: EU: 'The major enlargement of 2004 marked the start of a long reunification process for the old continent'
summary: The integration of 10 new countries – mostly from the former 'Eastern bloc' – remains one of the European Union's most unexpected and developmental successes, writes Le Monde columnist Philippe Ricard.

title: In Japan, yakuza are reduced to stealing Pokémon cards
summary: Organized crime syndicates are losing ground in the country while Pokémon merchandise has regained value after the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Paris 2024: The Olympic flame could 'only' arrive in France via Marseille
summary: After a highly contentious start, France's second-biggest city used its persuasive power to convince the Organising Committee to entrust it with the torch welcoming ceremony on May 8.

title: Want to maximize your public holiday? The French have some advice
summary: Making the most of public holidays in May requires a certain know-how. The French, who have five of those paid days off in May, certainly know how to make the most of it.

title: Xi Jinping's European visit takes him to allies Hungary and Serbia
summary: After France, the Chinese president is on the next leg of his European tour, where is expected to announce new investments there.

title: US pauses shipment of bombs to Israel over Rafah invasion
summary: US officials had declined for days to comment on the halted transfer, word of which came as Biden on Tuesday described US support for Israel as 'ironclad, even when we disagree.'

title: Sweden's sudden awakening to corruption
summary: From small arrangements between friends to large-scale bribery and embezzlement, Swedes are discovering the extent of a phenomenon they had underestimated.

title: Xi Jinping's visit to France fails to dispel clouds hanging over bilateral relations
summary: On Tuesday, the two heads of state visited the Hautes-Pyrénées in southern France. This 'personal' trip was marred by wintry weather.

title: Women, the first victims of global warming
summary: According to several scientific studies, heatwaves exacerbate gender inequalities in poor countries, reports Julien Bouissou in his column.

title: Trump trial: Stormy Daniels gives a detailed account of their one-night stand
summary: The hush money payment of $130,000, made to the former adult film star in exchange for her silence ahead of the 2016 presidential election, is an essential part of the charges leveled against the former US president.

title: Paris 2024: Marseille's northern districts, so close and yet so far from the Olympics
summary: The Olympic flame will reach Marseille on May 8. Despite the local authorities' best efforts, residents of the city's working-class districts have struggled to grasp the sporting event's appeal.

title: Online scams: Behind the scenes of the world's largest network of fake online retailers
summary: A vast network of fake clothing retail sites, operated from China, has scammed over 170,000 people in France alone over the past four years. Internal documents reveal how it operates.

title: Emma Rafowicz, the French Socialist undaunted by anti-Semitic attacks
summary: Running in 8th place on the French Parti Socialiste's list of candidates for the European elections, the president of the Young Socialists has been targeted due to her family ties with an Israeli army spokesman.

title: European elections: Macron's camp presents 48-part agenda and candidate list dominated by incumbents
summary: The three leaders of the majority parties, Edouard Philippe (Horizons), François Bayrou (MoDem) and Stéphane Séjourné (Renaissance), as well as former prime minister Elisabeth Borne appear at the bottom of Valérie Hayer's slate.

title: Israel says it reopened Kerem Shalom border crossing for Gaza aid
summary: The move comes four days after the border crossing was closed in response to a rocket attack that killed four soldiers.
